name: Witch’s Market – Blaak
description: Hidden within the bustling Markthal, a secret stall appears only to potion seekers. Here, you’ll find a rare herb called Moonleaf, glowing faintly under neon lights.

name: Crystal Caves – Euromast Park
description: Beneath the calm of Euromast Park lies a hidden cave where Crystal Slimes dwell. Carefully harvest glowing slime residue, known as Crystal Essence.

name: Erasmus Tower Ruins
description: An arcane storm once struck the Erasmus Bridge, leaving behind fragments of pure energy. Climb to the tower’s ghostly remains to collect Arc Dust.

name: Botanic Enclave – Trompenburg
description: This hidden garden holds the last living Lumina Root, a magical plant that blooms only under moonlight. Beware of enchanted thorns.

name: Old Clock Tower – Delfshaven
description: The ticking of time echoes from this medieval tower. Brewmasters say the last piece of the potion lies here: a time-frozen feather from a Chrono Owl.

name: Dragon’s Forge – Waalhaven
description: Among the shipyards and steel, a hidden forge pulses with dragonfire. Only those with courage may extract a vial of Ignis Ember from the coals.

name: Siren’s Wharf – Kop van Zuid
description: Fog rolls in thick over the Maas as siren songs lure the curious. At the water’s edge, shimmering scales called Tideglass lie buried in driftwood.

name: Whispering Library – Centrale Bibliotheek
description: Between ancient tomes and enchanted scrolls, the Whispering Library hides the Scrollvine — a creeping plant that stores echoes of spells.

name: Feywild Grove – Kralingse Bos
description: Deep within the forest, time flows oddly. The grove is home to a sprite colony and a rare bloom: the Twilily, a flower that only opens at dusk.

name: Obsidian Vault – Rotterdam Centraal
description: Below the train station’s sleek surface lies an ancient vault of black stone. Brave the guardian shadows to retrieve the rare Obsidian Core.
